text: I went back to UW-Madison for a visit a few years ago and got a tour of a new building created to generate patents. But it didn't appear it was used for much. Extravagant and luxurious. Very unlike a typical utilitarian campus building at a large state school. I learned they built it to recruit a professor who generated billions from patents, and I guess they felt was likely to continue to do so. The money apparently flows to the university, but the professor gets to work in a Taj Mahal of campus buildings. Not sure. But it was very impressive, and surprising.
